page.title: 08MARKET TRADING IN DONCASTER
page.content: THERE HAS BEEN A MARKET IN DONCASTER SINCE ROMAN TIMES. FOR THE SIZE OF THE TOWN THE MARKET IS VAST.MARKET DAYS ARE TUESDAYS,FRIDAYS AND SATURDAYS. THERE ARE FIVE MARKET AREAS: {THE CORN EXCHANGE},BUILT OVER THE OLD OUTDOOR CORN MARKET IN 1873,WAS DESIGNED BY WILLIAM WATKINS,A LINCOLN ARCHITECT.THE COUNCIL CONVERTED IT INTO A RETAIL GENERAL MARKET IN 1967.{ {THE OUTER MARKET}CONSISTS OF OUTSIDE STALLS DEALING IN VEGETABLES AND GENERAL GOODS.{THE MARKET HALL}WAS KNOWN AS THE SHAMBLES AND IS FOR THE BUTCHERY,EGG AND GROCERY TRADES.{THE {WOOL MARKET}IS A COVERED AREA USED IN EARLIER YEARS FOR WOOL FAIRS,NOW FOR GENERAL, NON-FOOD STALLS.{THE FISH {MARKET}IS DIVIDED INTO TWO PARTS,ONE SELLING GENERAL GOODS,THE OTHER FISH AND POULTRY.
